title: Hi! I'm Kaitlynn Chan
profile: Aspiring software engineer new grad and advocate for women in STEM, interested in securing businesses through cybersecurity.
aboutMe:
I am an undergraduate student at Simon Fraser University, pursuing a degree in Computer Science with a minor in Business. Passionate about technology and community, I thrive on connecting with others, learning from their journeys, and seeking challenges that push me to grow. I have represented SFU in a global cybersecurity competition and played a key role as an early contributor in enhancing a startup.
Beyond academics, I am committed to fostering inclusivity in STEM, earning multiple grants and awards for impactful contributions.
Highlights:
  • Leading a team of 10 over five months to organize a free outreach event for high school female and non-binary students, securing over $6,000 in sponsorships and empowering over 80 student to pursue a career in STEM.
  • Coordinating a networking event with the Women in Engineering club, connecting 70 students with industry mentors.
  • Establishing SFU’s first cross-institutional collaboration with a neighboring university — UBC — to strengthen intercollegiate relations.
  • Representing SFU at multiple conferences to advocate for diversity in STEM.

achievements.name: Ryan Wilk Mastercard Memorial Award in Computing Science

projects.name: Connect Quest
projects.description: A gamified social interaction app that sends daily challenges to users to engage with their community. Challenge completion awards users points to compete with friends.

projects.name: Dine Buddy
projects.description: An Android app allows foodies to create an account and create an inventory of favs using the google maps to visualize places.
projects.techStack: Java, Kotlin, Google Maps API, Auth0, NoSQL, Google Firestore

projects.name: Chroma Scan
projects.description: This tool allows users to select a source image and creating a color palette, including the complimenting and dominant colors.

projects.name: Capture the Flag
projects.description: A fun and engaging gamified learning experience for try/CATCH participants (high school female and non-binary students) to grasp computer science basics.
projects.techStack: JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Google Apps Script

projects.name: Filomator
projects.description: A file management desktop application that monitors folders for incoming files and moves them to their destination. Users input where they want files to go, what files to monitor and when.

projects.name: Recipe Extractor
projects.description: This Chome extension extracts a recipe from a blog and easily displays it to users.

projects.name: Reel Deal
projects.description: An immersive Android game where users search for the fishes implemented in Java. Users can choose how difficult they want to play and compete to improve their high scores.

projects.name: Find It
projects.description: Users match images on the cards and compete for high scores. There is exactly 1 match for each pair of cards. Users can customize card images with Flickr or from their photo gallery.

projects.name: CShell
projects.description: A command line interpreter that forks processes to allow multiple commands to be run efficiently and independently. Users can run a script of commands.
